snippet: The group says women should start having mammograms at 45 and continue yearly until 54; it previously recommended mammograms and clinical breast exams every year, starting at 40.
abstract: American Cancer Society says women with average risk of breast cancer should begin screening for mammograms at age 45 and continue once a year, dropping to ever two years after age 54; change increases starting age and decreases frequency previously recommended by organization, but issue is likely to remain unsettled.
